required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Midline Catheter and Its Impact on Central Lines Removal in ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Midline Catheter and Its Impact on Central Lines Removal in ICU

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate 2 strategies to remove central venous catheter (CVC): in one part, the insertion of a midline catheter and in the other part, the conventional insertion of peripheral venous catheter (PVC)

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will be randomised when the last indication for CVC has disappeared, which means parenteral nutrition or vasopressors administration.
They will be randomised either in the midline group or in the PVC group.
- In the midline group, a midline catheter will try to be inserted before the 48th hour after last indication for CVC disappeared.
- In the PVC group: a PVC will try to be inserted before the 48th hour after last indication for CVC disappeared.
If successful, CVC will then be removed. If not, a PVC will try to be inserted daily till success or worthlessness of a venous line or death.
The presence of a CVC will be assessed at the 96th hour after disappearance of last CVC indication.

primary_outcome.measure: % of patient with a successful Removal of CVC at the 96th hour after disappearance of last indication for CVC
primary_outcome.time_frame: H96 : 96th hour after disappearance of last indication for CVC
primary_outcome.description: A successful removal of CVC is defined as success of midline/PVC insertion at H96 and consequently CVC removal and no necessity for insertion of a new CVC within the 96 first hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of puncture required for the insertion of a peripheral catheter
Total number of peripheral catheter used

secondary_outcome.description: Total time of catheterisation, (measured from the entrance in patient room, to the exit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of blood culture for research of catheter-related bloodstream infection (CRBSI)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from disappearance of CVC indication to last CVC removal or 28 days after randomisation if still in place

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of CVC colonized for per 1000 CVC /days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from ICU, an expected average of 12 days
Until discharge from hospital, an expected average of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital stay in medical and surgical unit (no follow-up and rehabilitation care unit or long stay)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from ICU, an expected average of 12 days
Until discharge from hospital, an expected average of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: mortality in medical and surgical unit (no SSR or long stay)

other_outcome.time_frame: until removal,an expected average of 10 days after insertion
other_outcome.description: swabbing will be performed at catheter removal and its tips will be also analyzed

other_outcome.measure: Colonization of skin at insert point of Midline catheter
other_outcome.description: swabbing will be performed at every change of dressing

other_outcome.time_frame: until removal in ICU,an expected average of 10 days after insertion
other_outcome.description: thrombosis will be checked by ultrasound-echography if midline is removed in ICU

arm_group.description: Pt. will receive a standard Peripheral venous catheter

intervention.description: Patient will receive a Midline catheter within 48h after disappearance of indication for CVC
Patient will receive a standard PVC within 48h after disappearance of indication for CVC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years of age
- admitted to ICU since at least 48h
- with a perfusion CVC inserted
- requiring or having required invasive mechanical ventilation
- lack of formal indication to CVC maintenance (weaning of vasopressors and/or parenteral nutrition) since at least 24 hours
- indication to maintain a venous access
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of patient or next of kin consent
- Personnel for insertion of midline catheter not available
- Admission in ICU before study start
- Admission following a transfer from another ICU
- Patient with an implantable port or a peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC Line)
- Known intolerance to components of study Midline device
- Past history of irradiation of insert area of midline catheter
- Past history of bilateral axillary lymph node dissection
- Pre-existing skin infection on upper limb
- Patient with a treatment-limitation decision
- Patient admitted after cardiac arrest with non-shockable rhythm
- Moribund
- Pregnancy, breastfeeding woman
- Patient under legal guardianship
- Patient hospitalized without consent and/or deprived of liberty by court's decision
